item.description:
Starting the season off with a nice easy ride and enjoy the spring weather.

Let's ride the very flat, shady, scenic Nashua - Ayer Rail Trail (24 miles round trip), stopping for ice cream, looking at the pond, and finishing at 31 Main in Ayer for refreshments. This is a nice ride because it's impossible to get lost. This rail trail is usually pretty low on traffic. There are wet lands offering beautiful views to enjoy. There's a commuter rail out to Ayer too. 

Slick road surfaces will cancel the ride.

Bring water, patch kit, clothing layers, cell phone, bike helmet, sun screen, energy food, air pump etc.

I like to move at an average of 14 MPH. We'll have plenty of stops for people to catch up and plenty of places to push yourself too. If we get a lot of riders we can split into a couple groups.

If there are any questions, please post or send me a personal message.

- Douglas
item.how_to_find_us: Brown Mini and down by the restrooms
item.name: Ride the Scenic Nashua - Ayer Rail Trail
